Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that David Beckham was not actually wearing a 'Free West Papua' T-shirt.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a doctored image and not actual evidence.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that David Beckham's T-shirt indicates support for the independence movement in West Papua, which may not be accurate.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation for the T-shirt, as it was actually part of a BBC program and related to UNICEF's work in Papua New Guinea.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of Beckham wearing the T-shirt by suggesting it was a secret visit and that people were surprised by it.
Understate: There is no evidence of any understatement bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times in the provided information.
